Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Biventricular Pacing After Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: 50 adult patients at high risk of left ventricular dysfunction post-cardiac surgery were randomised

Participants.evidence: 50 adult patients at high risk of left ventricular dysfunction post-cardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either temporary biventricular pacing or standard care (no pacing)

Method_Outcome.evidence: VIS was measured after cardiopulmonary bypass, after sternal closure, and 0–7 hours post-intensive care unit (ICU) admission

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 50 adult patients at high risk of left ventricular dysfunction post-cardiac surgery were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: VIS decreased in the biventricular pacing group from 12.0±1.5 to 10.5±2.0, while it increased in the standard care group from 12.5±1.9 to 15.5±2.9
